title: 106_hr753
content: The Act titled "Fairness in IRS Debt Payment Act of 1999" mandates compounding interest annually on tax underpayments. The Act "Fairness in IRS Debt Payment Act of 1999" requires annual compounding of interest on tax underpayments, with exceptions for penalties and additions to tax. The "Fairness in IRS Debt Payment Act of 1999" mandates interest on tax underpayments to compound annually, with exceptions for penalties and additions to tax. Payments on underpayments are allocated first to amounts not considered tax, then to tax amounts. The amendment applies to interest after December 31, 1999. SEC. 3 of the "Fairness in IRS Debt Payment Act of 1999" addresses the allocation of payments to underpayments, allowing the Secretary of the Treasury to allocate payments equally among underpayments or as directed by the taxpayer. It applies to payments made after December 31, 1999. Section 6159 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to prohibit modifications of installment agreements once entered into, except for failure to make timely payments. The Internal Revenue Code prohibits modifications to installment agreements once entered into, except for failure to make timely payments. Section 6159 is amended to remove paragraphs (3) and (4) and renumber paragraph (5) as paragraph (3). The amendments apply to agreements entered into after December 31, 1999. SEC. 5. LIMITATION ON AGGREGATE INTEREST AND PENALTIES. Amends Section 6404 of the Internal Revenue Code to abate excessive interest and penalties. Effective upon enactment. SEC. 6. GUIDELINES AND CRITERIA FOR PENALTY ABATEMENT; REQUIRED EXPLANATION OF REFUSAL TO ABATE PENALTIES. Section 6404 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to include guidelines and criteria for penalty abatement. The Secretary will determine whether to abate penalties based on these guidelines. If a taxpayer's request for penalty abatement is not fully granted, the Secretary must provide a written explanation for the refusal. The amendment made by subsection (a) regarding penalty abatement guidelines will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
